title: iPhone 17 Pro stars in new hands-on images
description: The iPhone 17 Pro and iPhone 17 Pro Max, coming this September most likely, will bring with them a redesign of the rear, where there's going to be a massive camera island taking up the entire width of the device, Poco-style (in fairness, that's Poco from a while back, the Xiaomi sub-brand has since given up on such designs). Today a couple of new hands-on images have been leaked depicting what is probably an iPhone 17 Pro dummy unit. Regardless of the fact that there are no electronics inside, this should be 1:1 accurate size-wise and design-wise to the final product, so the images are...
excerpt: It's probably a dummy unit, but it doesn't matter - it showcases the new design very well. The iPhone 17 Pro and iPhone 17 Pro Max, coming this September...
text: The iPhone 17 Pro and iPhone 17 Pro Max, coming this September most likely, will bring with them a redesign of the rear, where there's going to be a massive camera island taking up the entire width of the device, Poco-style (in fairness, that's Poco from a while back, the Xiaomi sub-brand has since given up on such designs). Today a couple of new hands-on images have been leaked depicting what is probably an iPhone 17 Pro dummy unit. Regardless of the fact that there are no electronics inside, this should be 1:1 accurate size-wise and design-wise to the final product, so the images are very useful - we can take another look at that camera 'visor' thing. iPhone 17 Pro looks so good pic.twitter.com/P7aFwR5FML— Majin Bu (@MajinBuOfficial) July 10, 2025 The cameras themselves seem to be in the exact same positions as they were in the iPhone 16 Pro, they're just part of a much larger island now. Otherwise, this looks like a recent iPhone, there's not much more to say. It's been rumored to switch to an aluminum frame along with the iPhone 17 Pro Max, ending the years-long experiments with stainless steel and titanium. There will also apparently be a repositioned Apple logo on the back, now centered between the bottom of the phone and the bottom of the camera island in what is surely going to be quite a controversial design decision on the internet. html:
The iPhone 17 Pro and iPhone 17 Pro Max, coming this September most likely, will bring with them a redesign of the rear, where there's going to be a massive camera island taking up the entire width of the device, Poco-style (in fairness, that's Poco from a while back, the Xiaomi sub-brand has since given up on such designs).

Today a couple of new hands-on images have been leaked depicting what is probably an iPhone 17 Pro dummy unit. Regardless of the fact that there are no electronics inside, this should be 1:1 accurate size-wise and design-wise to the final product, so the images are very useful - we can take another look at that camera 'visor' thing.

iPhone 17 Pro looks so good pic.twitter.com/P7aFwR5FML

— Majin Bu (@MajinBuOfficial) July 10, 2025

The cameras themselves seem to be in the exact same positions as they were in the iPhone 16 Pro, they're just part of a much larger island now. Otherwise, this looks like a recent iPhone, there's not much more to say. It's been rumored to switch to an aluminum frame along with the iPhone 17 Pro Max, ending the years-long experiments with stainless steel and titanium.

There will also apparently be a repositioned Apple logo on the back, now centered between the bottom of the phone and the bottom of the camera island in what is surely going to be quite a controversial design decision on the internet.

Apple iPhone 16 Pro
